def load_volleyball_teams(start_year: int = 2011, sport: str = None) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
512def load_volleyball_teams(
513    start_year: int = 2011,
514    sport: str = None
515) -> pd.DataFrame:
516    """
517    Compiles a list of known NCAA volleyball teams in NCAA volleyball history.
518
519    Parameters
520    ----------
521    start_year : int, default 2011
522        Specifies the first season you want NCAA volleyball team information from.
523
524    sport : str, optional
525        Sport type: "women"/"w"/"wvb" for women's volleyball (default),
526        "men"/"m"/"mvb" for men's volleyball.
527        If None, uses the configured default.
528
529    Examples
530    --------
531    # Load in every women's volleyball team from 2011 to present day
532    >>> df = load_volleyball_teams()
533    
534    # Load in every men's volleyball team from 2011 to present day  
535    >>> df = load_volleyball_teams(sport="men")
536    
537    # Load in every women's volleyball team from 2020 to present day
538    >>> df = load_volleyball_teams(start_year=2020)
539
540    Returns
541    -------
542    pd.DataFrame
543        A pandas DataFrame object with a list of all known college volleyball teams.
544    """
545    if sport is None:
546        sport = volleyball_config.default_sport
547    
548    get_mens_data, sport_id = _get_sport_params(sport)
549
550    teams_df = pd.DataFrame()
551    teams_df_arr = []
552    temp_df = pd.DataFrame()
553
554    now = datetime.now()
555    mens_ncaa_divisions = ["I", "III"]
556    womens_ncaa_divisions = ["I", "II", "III"]
557    if now.month > 5 and get_mens_data is False:
558        ncaa_seasons = [x for x in range(start_year, (now.year + 2))]
559    elif now.month < 5 and get_mens_data is True:
560        ncaa_seasons = [x for x in range(start_year, (now.year + 1))]
561    else:
562        ncaa_seasons = [x for x in range(start_year, (now.year + 1))]
563
564    sport_name = "men's" if get_mens_data else "women's"
565    logging.info(
566        f"Loading in all NCAA {sport_name} volleyball teams. "
567        + "If this is the first time you're seeing this message, "
568        + "it may take some time (3-10 minutes) for this to load."
569    )
570
571    if get_mens_data is True:
572        for s in ncaa_seasons:
573            logging.info(
574                f"Loading in men's volleyball teams for the {s} season."
575            )
576            for d in mens_ncaa_divisions:
577                temp_df = _get_volleyball_teams_internal(
578                    season=s,
579                    level=d,
580                    get_mens_data=True
581                )
582                teams_df_arr.append(temp_df)
583                del temp_df
584    else:
585        for s in ncaa_seasons:
586            logging.info(
587                f"Loading in women's volleyball teams for the {s} season."
588            )
589            for d in womens_ncaa_divisions:
590                temp_df = _get_volleyball_teams_internal(
591                    season=s,
592                    level=d,
593                    get_mens_data=False
594                )
595                teams_df_arr.append(temp_df)
596                del temp_df
597
598    teams_df = pd.concat(teams_df_arr, ignore_index=True)
599    teams_df = teams_df.infer_objects()
600    return teams_df

Compiles a list of known NCAA volleyball teams in NCAA volleyball history.

Parameters

start_year : int, default 2011 Specifies the first season you want NCAA volleyball team information from.

sport : str, optional Sport type: "women"/"w"/"wvb" for women's volleyball (default), "men"/"m"/"mvb" for men's volleyball. If None, uses the configured default.

Examples

Load in every women's volleyball team from 2011 to present day

>>> df = load_volleyball_teams()

Load in every men's volleyball team from 2011 to present day

>>> df = load_volleyball_teams(sport="men")

Load in every women's volleyball team from 2020 to present day

>>> df = load_volleyball_teams(start_year=2020)

Returns

pd.DataFrame A pandas DataFrame object with a list of all known college volleyball teams.

def get_volleyball_team_schedule(team_id: int) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
 603def get_volleyball_team_schedule(team_id: int) -> pd.DataFrame:
 604    """
 605    Retrieves a team schedule, from a valid NCAA volleyball team ID.
 606
 607    Parameters
 608    ----------
 609    team_id : int
 610        Required argument.
 611        Specifies the team you want a schedule from.
 612        This is separate from a school ID, which identifies the institution.
 613        A team ID should be unique to a school, and a season.
 614
 615    Examples
 616    --------
 617    # Get the team schedule for the 2024 Toledo WVB team (D1, ID: 585329)
 618    >>> df = get_volleyball_team_schedule(585329)
 619    
 620    # Get the team schedule for the 2024 Hawaii MVB team (D1, ID: 573674)
 621    >>> df = get_volleyball_team_schedule(573674)
 622
 623    Returns
 624    -------
 625    pd.DataFrame
 626        A pandas DataFrame object with an NCAA volleyball team's schedule.
 627    """
 628    sport_id = ""
 629    schools_df = _get_schools()
 630    games_df = pd.DataFrame()
 631    games_df_arr = []
 632    season = 0
 633    temp_df = pd.DataFrame()
 634    load_from_cache = True
 635
 636    home_dir = expanduser("~")
 637    home_dir = _format_folder_str(home_dir)
 638
 639    url = f"https://stats.ncaa.org/teams/{team_id}"
 640
 641    current_year = datetime.now().year
 642    estimated_season = current_year if datetime.now().month > 7 else current_year - 1
 643
 644    season_found = False
 645    for year_offset in range(0, 3):
 646        try_season = estimated_season - year_offset
 647    
 648        # Try women's volleyball first
 649        for division in [1, 2, 3]:
 650            try:
 651                team_df = get_volleyball_teams(try_season, division, sport="women")
 652                team_match = team_df[team_df["team_id"] == team_id]
 653                
 654                if len(team_match) > 0:
 655                    season = team_match["season"].iloc[0]
 656                    ncaa_division = team_match["ncaa_division"].iloc[0]
 657                    ncaa_division_formatted = team_match["ncaa_division_formatted"].iloc[0]
 658                    sport_id = "WVB"
 659                    season_found = True
 660                    break
 661            except Exception:
 662                continue
 663        
 664        if season_found:
 665            break
 666            
 667        # Try men's volleyball
 668        for division in [1, 3]:
 669            try:
 670                team_df = get_volleyball_teams(try_season, division, sport="men")
 671                team_match = team_df[team_df["team_id"] == team_id]
 672                
 673                if len(team_match) > 0:
 674                    season = team_match["season"].iloc[0]
 675                    ncaa_division = team_match["ncaa_division"].iloc[0]
 676                    ncaa_division_formatted = team_match["ncaa_division_formatted"].iloc[0]
 677                    sport_id = "MVB"
 678                    season_found = True
 679                    break
 680            except Exception:
 681                continue
 682        
 683        if season_found:
 684            break
 685
 686    del team_df
 687
 688    if exists(f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/"):
 689        pass
 690    else:
 691        mkdir(f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/")
 692
 693    if exists(f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/volleyball_{sport_id}/"):
 694        pass
 695    else:
 696        mkdir(f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/volleyball_{sport_id}/")
 697
 698    if exists(
 699        f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/volleyball_{sport_id}/team_schedule/"
 700    ):
 701        pass
 702    else:
 703        mkdir(
 704            f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/volleyball_{sport_id}/team_schedule/"
 705        )
 706
 707    if exists(
 708        f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/volleyball_{sport_id}/team_schedule/"
 709        + f"{team_id}_team_schedule.csv"
 710    ):
 711        games_df = pd.read_csv(
 712            f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/volleyball_{sport_id}/team_schedule/"
 713            + f"{team_id}_team_schedule.csv"
 714        )
 715        file_mod_datetime = datetime.fromtimestamp(
 716            getmtime(
 717                f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/"
 718                + f"volleyball_{sport_id}/team_schedule/"
 719                + f"{team_id}_team_schedule.csv"
 720            )
 721        )
 722    else:
 723        file_mod_datetime = datetime.today()
 724        load_from_cache = False
 725
 726    now = datetime.today()
 727
 728    age = now - file_mod_datetime
 729    if (
 730        age.days > 1 and
 731        season >= now.year
 732    ):
 733        load_from_cache = False
 734
 735    if load_from_cache is True:
 736        return games_df
 737
 738    response = _get_webpage(url=url)
 739    soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, features="lxml")
 740
 741    school_name = soup.find("div", {"class": "card"}).find("img").get("alt")
 742    season_name = (
 743        soup.find("select", {"id": "year_list"})
 744        .find("option", {"selected": "selected"})
 745        .text
 746    )
 747
 748    soup = soup.find_all(
 749        "div",
 750        {"class": "col p-0"},
 751    )
 752
 753    table_data = ""
 754    for s in soup:
 755        try:
 756            temp_name = s.find("div", {"class": "card-header"})
 757            temp_name = temp_name.text
 758        except Exception as e:
 759            logging.warning(
 760                f"Could not parse card header. Full exception `{e}`. "
 761                + "Attempting alternate method."
 762            )
 763            temp_name = s.find("tr", {"class": "heading"}).find("td").text
 764
 765        if "schedule" in temp_name.lower():
 766            table_data = s.find("table")
 767
 768    t_rows = table_data.find_all("tr", {"class": "underline_rows"})
 769
 770    if len(t_rows) == 0:
 771        t_rows = table_data.find_all("tr")
 772
 773    for g in t_rows:
 774        is_valid_row = True
 775        game_num = 1
 776        ot_periods = 0
 777        is_home_game = True
 778        is_neutral_game = False
 779
 780        cells = g.find_all("td")
 781        if len(cells) <= 1:
 782            continue
 783
 784        game_date = cells[0].text
 785
 786        if "(" in game_date:
 787            game_date = game_date.replace(")", "")
 788            game_date, game_num = game_date.split("(")
 789            game_date = game_date.strip()
 790            game_num = int(game_num.strip())
 791
 792        if ":" in game_date and ("PM" in game_date or "AM" in game_date):
 793            game_date = datetime.strptime(
 794                game_date,
 795                "%m/%d/%Y %I:%M %p"
 796            ).date()
 797        else:
 798            game_date = datetime.strptime(
 799                game_date,
 800                "%m/%d/%Y"
 801            ).date()
 802
 803        try:
 804            opp_team_id = cells[1].find("a").get("href")
 805        except IndexError:
 806            logging.info(
 807                "Skipping row because it is clearly "
 808                + "not a row that has schedule data."
 809            )
 810            is_valid_row = False
 811        except AttributeError as e:
 812            logging.info(
 813                "Could not extract a team ID for this game. " +
 814                f"Full exception {e}"
 815            )
 816            opp_team_id = "-1"
 817        except Exception as e:
 818            logging.warning(
 819                "An unhandled exception has occurred when "
 820                + "trying to get the opposition team ID for this game. "
 821                f"Full exception `{e}`."
 822            )
 823            raise e
 824        if is_valid_row is True:
 825            if opp_team_id is not None:
 826                opp_team_id = opp_team_id.replace("/teams/", "")
 827                opp_team_id = int(opp_team_id)
 828
 829                try:
 830                    opp_team_name = cells[1].find("img").get("alt")
 831                except AttributeError:
 832                    logging.info(
 833                        "Couldn't find the opposition team name "
 834                        + "for this row from an image element. "
 835                        + "Attempting a backup method"
 836                    )
 837                    opp_team_name = cells[1].text
 838                except Exception as e:
 839                    logging.info(
 840                        "Unhandled exception when trying to get the "
 841                        + "opposition team name from this game. "
 842                        + f"Full exception `{e}`"
 843                    )
 844                    raise e
 845            else:
 846                opp_team_name = cells[1].text
 847
 848            if opp_team_name[0] == "@":
 849                opp_team_name = opp_team_name.strip().replace("@", "")
 850            elif "@" in opp_team_name:
 851                opp_team_name = opp_team_name.strip().split("@")[0]
 852
 853            opp_text = cells[1].text
 854            opp_text = opp_text.strip()
 855            if "@" in opp_text and opp_text[0] == "@":
 856                is_home_game = False
 857            elif "@" in opp_text and opp_text[0] != "@":
 858                is_neutral_game = True
 859                is_home_game = False
 860            # This is just to cover conference and NCAA championship
 861            # tournaments.
 862            elif "championship" in opp_text.lower():
 863                is_neutral_game = True
 864                is_home_game = False
 865            elif "ncaa" in opp_text.lower():
 866                is_neutral_game = True
 867                is_home_game = False
 868
 869            del opp_text
 870
 871            score = cells[2].text.strip()
 872            if len(score) == 0:
 873                score_1 = 0
 874                score_2 = 0
 875            elif (
 876                "canceled" not in score.lower() and
 877                "ppd" not in score.lower()
 878            ):
 879                score_1, score_2 = score.split("-")
 880
 881                if any(x in score_1 for x in ["W", "L", "T"]):
 882                    score_1 = score_1.split(" ")[1]
 883
 884                if "(" in score_2:
 885                    score_2 = score_2.replace(")", "")
 886                    score_2, ot_periods = score_2.split("(")
 887                    ot_periods = ot_periods.replace("OT", "")
 888                    ot_periods = ot_periods.replace(" ", "")
 889                    ot_periods = int(ot_periods)
 890
 891                if ot_periods is None:
 892                    ot_periods = 0
 893                score_1 = int(score_1)
 894                score_2 = int(score_2)
 895            else:
 896                score_1 = None
 897                score_2 = None
 898
 899            try:
 900                game_id = cells[2].find("a").get("href")
 901                game_id = game_id.replace("/contests", "")
 902                game_id = game_id.replace("/box_score", "")
 903                game_id = game_id.replace("/", "")
 904                game_id = int(game_id)
 905                game_url = (
 906                    f"https://stats.ncaa.org/contests/{game_id}/box_score"
 907                )
 908            except AttributeError as e:
 909                logging.info(
 910                    "Could not parse a game ID for this game. "
 911                    + f"Full exception `{e}`."
 912                )
 913                game_id = None
 914                game_url = None
 915            except Exception as e:
 916                logging.info(
 917                    "An unhandled exception occurred when trying "
 918                    + "to find a game ID for this game. "
 919                    + f"Full exception `{e}`."
 920                )
 921                raise e
 922
 923            try:
 924                attendance = cells[3].text
 925                attendance = attendance.replace(",", "")
 926                attendance = attendance.replace("\n", "")
 927                attendance = int(attendance)
 928            except IndexError as e:
 929                logging.info(
 930                    "It doesn't appear as if there is an attendance column "
 931                    + "for this team's schedule table."
 932                    f"Full exception `{e}`."
 933                )
 934                attendance = None
 935            except ValueError as e:
 936                logging.info(
 937                    "There doesn't appear as if "
 938                    + "there is a recorded attendance. "
 939                    + "for this game/row. "
 940                    f"Full exception `{e}`."
 941                )
 942                attendance = None
 943            except Exception as e:
 944                logging.info(
 945                    "An unhandled exception occurred when trying "
 946                    + "to find this game's attendance. "
 947                    + f"Full exception `{e}`."
 948                )
 949                raise e
 950
 951            if is_home_game is True:
 952                temp_df = pd.DataFrame(
 953                    {
 954                        "season": season,
 955                        "season_name": season_name,
 956                        "game_id": game_id,
 957                        "game_date": game_date,
 958                        "game_num": game_num,
 959                        "ot_periods": ot_periods,
 960                        "home_team_id": team_id,
 961                        "home_team_name": school_name,
 962                        "away_team_id": opp_team_id,
 963                        "away_team_name": opp_team_name,
 964                        "home_team_sets_won": score_1,
 965                        "away_team_sets_won": score_2,
 966                        "is_neutral_game": is_neutral_game,
 967                        "game_url": game_url,
 968                    },
 969                    index=[0],
 970                )
 971                games_df_arr.append(temp_df)
 972                del temp_df
 973            elif is_neutral_game is True:
 974                t_ids = [opp_team_id, team_id]
 975                t_ids.sort()
 976
 977                if t_ids[0] == team_id:
 978                    temp_df = pd.DataFrame(
 979                        {
 980                            "season": season,
 981                            "season_name": season_name,
 982                            "game_id": game_id,

 984                            "game_num": game_num,

 988                            "away_team_id": opp_team_id,
 989                            "away_team_name": opp_team_name,
 990                            "home_team_sets_won": score_1,
 991                            "away_team_sets_won": score_2,
 992                            "is_neutral_game": is_neutral_game,
 993                            "game_url": game_url,
 994                        },
 995                        index=[0],
 996                    )
 997
 998                else:
 999                    temp_df = pd.DataFrame(
1000                        {
1001                            "season": season,
1002                            "season_name": season_name,
1003                            "game_id": game_id,
1004                            "game_date": game_date,
1005                            "game_num": game_num,
1006                            "ot_periods": ot_periods,
1007                            "home_team_id": opp_team_id,
1008                            "home_team_name": opp_team_name,
1009                            "away_team_id": team_id,
1010                            "away_team_name": school_name,
1011                            "home_team_sets_won": score_2,
1012                            "away_team_sets_won": score_1,
1013                            "is_neutral_game": is_neutral_game,
1014                            "game_url": game_url,
1015                        },
1016                        index=[0],
1017                    )
1018
1019                games_df_arr.append(temp_df)
1020                del temp_df
1021            else:
1022                temp_df = pd.DataFrame(
1023                    {
1024                        "season": season,
1025                        "season_name": season_name,
1026                        "game_id": game_id,
1027                        "game_date": game_date,
1028                        "game_num": game_num,
1029                        "ot_periods": ot_periods,
1030                        "home_team_id": opp_team_id,
1031                        "home_team_name": opp_team_name,
1032                        "away_team_id": team_id,
1033                        "away_team_name": school_name,

1036                        "is_neutral_game": is_neutral_game,
1037                        "game_url": game_url,
1038                    },
1039                    index=[0],
1040                )
1041
1042                games_df_arr.append(temp_df)
1043                del temp_df
1044
1045    games_df = pd.concat(games_df_arr, ignore_index=True)
1046
1047    temp_df = schools_df.rename(
1048        columns={
1049            "school_name": "home_team_name",
1050            "school_id": "home_school_id"
1051        }
1052    )
1053    games_df = games_df.merge(right=temp_df, on="home_team_name", how="left")
1054

1057            "school_name": "away_team_name",
1058            "school_id": "away_school_id"
1059        }
1060    )
1061    games_df = games_df.merge(right=temp_df, on="away_team_name", how="left")
1062    games_df["ncaa_division"] = ncaa_division
1063    games_df["ncaa_division_formatted"] = ncaa_division_formatted
1064
1065    games_df.to_csv(
1066        f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/"
1067        + f"volleyball_{sport_id}/team_schedule/"
1068        + f"{team_id}_team_schedule.csv",
1069        index=False,
1070    )
1071
1072    return games_df

Retrieves a team schedule, from a valid NCAA volleyball team ID.

Parameters

team_id : int Required argument. Specifies the team you want a schedule from. This is separate from a school ID, which identifies the institution. A team ID should be unique to a school, and a season.

Examples

Get the team schedule for the 2024 Toledo WVB team (D1, ID: 585329)

>>> df = get_volleyball_team_schedule(585329)

Get the team schedule for the 2024 Hawaii MVB team (D1, ID: 573674)

>>> df = get_volleyball_team_schedule(573674)

Returns

pd.DataFrame A pandas DataFrame object with an NCAA volleyball team's schedule.

Given a date and NCAA level, this function retrieves volleyball every game for that date.

Parameters

level : int | str, default "I" Required argument. Specifies the level/division you want a NCAA volleyball schedule from. This can either be an integer (1-3) or a string ("I"-"III").

Retrieves a full volleyball schedule from an NCAA level. The way this is done is by going through every team in a division, and parsing the schedules of every team in a division.

This function will take time when first run (30-60 minutes)! You have been warned.

Parameters

season : int Specifies the season you want a schedule from.

level : int | str, default "I" Specifies the level/division you want a schedule from.

sport : str, optional Sport type: "women"/"w"/"wvb" for women's volleyball (default), "men"/"m"/"mvb" for men's volleyball. If None, uses the configured default.

Examples

Get the entire 2024 schedule for the 2024 women's D1 volleyball season

>>> df = get_full_volleyball_schedule(season=2024, level="I")

Get the entire 2024 schedule for the 2024 men's D1 volleyball season

>>> df = get_full_volleyball_schedule(season=2024, level="I", sport="men")

Returns

pd.DataFrame A pandas DataFrame object with an NCAA volleyball schedule for a specific season and level.

2089    elif sport_id == "WVB":
2090        season = f"{season_name[0:4]}"
2091        season = int(season)
2092
2093    # Try to find the table by ID first (most reliable)
2094    table_data = soup.find("table", {"id": "stat_grid"})
2095
2096    # If not found by ID, try by class components
2097    if table_data is None:
2098        table_data = soup.find("table", class_="small_font dataTable table-bordered")
2099
2100    # Final fallback - look for any table with stat_grid ID or containing dataTable class
2101    if table_data is None:
2102        tables = soup.find_all("table")
2103        for table in tables:
2104            if (table.get("id") == "stat_grid" or 
2105                (table.get("class") and "dataTable" in " ".join(table.get("class")))):
2106                table_data = table
2107                break
2108
2109    # Check if stats table exists
2110    if table_data is None:
2111        logging.warning(f"Could not find stats table for team {team_id}. Team may not have player stats available.")
2112        return pd.DataFrame()  # Return empty DataFrame
2113
2114    thead = table_data.find("thead")
2115    if thead is None:
2116        logging.warning(f"Could not find table header for team {team_id}.")
2117        return pd.DataFrame()
2118
2119    temp_table_headers = thead.find("tr").find_all("th")
2120    table_headers = [x.text for x in temp_table_headers]
2121
2122    del temp_table_headers
2123
2124    tbody = table_data.find("tbody")
2125    if tbody is None:
2126        logging.warning(f"Could not find table body for team {team_id}.")
2127        return pd.DataFrame()
2128
2129    t_rows = tbody.find_all("tr", {"class": "text"})
2130    for t in t_rows:
2131        try:
2132            p_last = ""
2133            p_first = ""
2134            t_cells = t.find_all("td")
2135            
2136            # Skip if not enough cells or if it's a team/totals row
2137            if len(t_cells) < 2:
2138                continue
2139                
2140            # Check if this is a team totals row or opponent totals row
2141            cell_text = t_cells[1].text.lower().strip()
2142            if any(skip_word in cell_text for skip_word in ["team", "totals", "opponent"]):
2143                continue
2144
2145            # Get player name data
2146            p_sortable = t_cells[1].get("data-order")
2147            if p_sortable is None or len(p_sortable.strip()) == 0:
2148                continue
2149                
2150            p_sortable_parts = p_sortable.split(",")
2151            if len(p_sortable_parts) == 2:
2152                p_last, p_first = p_sortable_parts
2153            elif len(p_sortable_parts) == 3:
2154                p_last, temp_name, p_first = p_sortable_parts
2155                p_last = f"{p_last} {temp_name}"
2156            else:
2157                # Fallback: use the visible text
2158                p_last = t_cells[1].text.strip()
2159                p_first = ""
2160
2161            # Extract cell data
2162            t_cells_text = []
2163            for cell in t_cells:
2164                text = cell.text.strip() if cell.text else ""
2165                # Replace dashes and empty strings with proper values
2166                if text == "-" or text == "":
2167                    text = "0"
2168                # Remove commas from numbers
2169                text = text.replace(",", "")
2170                t_cells_text.append(text)
2171
2172            temp_df = pd.DataFrame(
2173                data=[t_cells_text],
2174                columns=table_headers,
2175            )
2176
2177            # Get player ID from link
2178            player_link = t.find("a")
2179            if player_link is None:
2180                continue
2181                
2182            player_href = player_link.get("href")
2183            if player_href is None:
2184                continue
2185
2186            player_id = player_href.replace("/players", "").replace("/", "")
2187            
2188            try:
2189                player_id = int(player_id)
2190            except ValueError:
2191                continue
2192
2193            temp_df["player_id"] = player_id
2194            temp_df["player_last_name"] = p_last.strip()
2195            temp_df["player_first_name"] = p_first.strip()
2196
2197            stats_df_arr.append(temp_df)
2198            del temp_df
2199            
2200        except Exception as e:
2201            logging.warning(f"Error processing player row for team {team_id}: {e}")
2202            continue
2203
2204    stats_df = pd.concat(stats_df_arr, ignore_index=True)
2205    stats_df = stats_df.replace("", None)
2206
2207    stats_df["season"] = season
2208    stats_df["season_name"] = season_name
2209    stats_df["school_id"] = school_id
2210    stats_df["school_name"] = school_name
2211    stats_df["ncaa_division"] = ncaa_division
2212    stats_df["ncaa_division_formatted"] = ncaa_division_formatted
2213    stats_df["team_conference_name"] = team_conference_name
2214    stats_df["sport_id"] = sport_id
2215    stats_df["team_id"] = team_id
2216
2217    stats_df = stats_df.infer_objects()
2218
2219    stats_df.rename(
2220        columns={
2221            "#": "player_jersey_number",
2222            "Player": "player_full_name",
2223            "Yr": "player_class",
2224            "Pos": "player_position",
2225            "Ht": "player_height",
2226            "S": "sets_played",
2227            "Kills": "kills",
2228            "Errors": "errors",
2229            "Total Attacks": "total_attacks",
2230            "Hit Pct": "hit%",
2231            "Assists": "assists",
2232            "Aces": "aces",
2233            "SErr": "serve_errors",
2234            "Digs": "digs",
2235            "RetAtt": "return_attacks",
2236            "RErr": "return_errors",
2237            "Block Solos": "solo_blocks",
2238            "Block Assists": "assisted_blocks",
2239            "BErr": "block_errors",
2240            "PTS": "points",
2241            "Trpl Dbl": "TRP_DBL",
2242            "Dbl Dbl": "DBL_DBL",
2243            "TB": "total_blocks",
2244            "SrvAtt": "serve_attempts",
2245        },
2246        inplace=True,
2247    )
2248
2249    for i in stats_df.columns:
2250        if i in stat_columns:
2251            pass
2252        elif "Attend" in stat_columns:
2253            pass
2254        else:
2255            raise ValueError(
2256                f"Unhandled column name {i}"
2257            )
2258    stats_df = stats_df.reindex(columns=stat_columns)
2259
2260    stats_df = stats_df.infer_objects().fillna(0)
2261    stats_df = stats_df.astype(
2262        {
2263            "GP": "uint16",
2264            "GS": "uint16",
2265            "sets_played": "uint16",
2266            "kills": "uint16",
2267            "errors": "uint16",
2268            "total_attacks": "uint16",
2269            "hit%": "float32",
2270            "assists": "uint16",
2271            "aces": "uint16",
2272            "serve_errors": "uint16",
2273            "digs": "uint16",
2274            "return_attacks": "uint16",
2275            "return_errors": "uint16",
2276            "solo_blocks": "uint16",
2277            "assisted_blocks": "uint16",
2278            "block_errors": "uint16",
2279            "points": "float32",
2280            "BHE": "uint16",
2281            "TRP_DBL": "uint16",
2282            "serve_attempts": "uint16",
2283            "total_blocks": "float32",
2284            "DBL_DBL": "uint16",
2285            "school_id": "uint32",
2286        }
2287    )
2288
2289    stats_df["hit%"] = stats_df["hit%"].round(3)
2290    stats_df["points"] = stats_df["points"].round(1)
2291
2292    stats_df.to_csv(
2293        f"{home_dir}/.ncaa_stats_py/" +
2294        f"volleyball_{sport_id}/player_season_stats/" +
2295        f"{season:00d}_{school_id:00d}_player_season_stats.csv",
2296        index=False,
2297    )
2298
2299    return stats_df

Given a team ID, this function retrieves and parses the season stats for all of the players in a given volleyball team.

Parameters

team_id : int Required argument. Specifies the team you want volleyball stats from. This is separate from a school ID, which identifies the institution. A team ID should be unique to a school, and a season.

team_info : dict, optional Team metadata to avoid loading all teams data. Should contain: season, ncaa_division, ncaa_division_formatted, team_conference_name, school_name, school_id, sport_id

Examples

Get the season stats for the 2024 Ohio St. team (D1, ID: 585398)

>>> df = get_volleyball_player_season_stats(585398)

Get the season stats with team info to avoid data loading

>>> team_info = {...}  # from get_volleyball_teams()
>>> df = get_volleyball_player_season_stats(585398, team_info)

Returns

pd.DataFrame A pandas DataFrame object with the season stats for all players with a given NCAA volleyball team.

def get_womens_volleyball_season_data(season: int, level: str | int = 1) -> dict: 
2343def get_womens_volleyball_season_data(season: int, level: str | int = 1) -> dict:
2344    """
2345    Get complete women's volleyball season data in one call.
2346    
2347    Parameters
2348    ----------
2349    season : int
2350        The season year
2351    level : str | int, default 1
2352        NCAA division
2353        
2354    Examples
2355    --------
2356    >>> data = get_womens_volleyball_season_data(2024, 1)
2357    >>> teams = data['teams']
2358    >>> schedule = data['schedule'] 
2359    >>> player_stats = data['player_stats']
2360    
2361    Returns
2362    -------
2363    dict
2364        Dictionary with keys: 'teams', 'schedule', 'player_stats'
2365    """
2366    teams_df = get_womens_volleyball_teams(season, level)
2367    
2368    logging.info("Loading full schedule...")
2369    schedule_df = get_full_volleyball_schedule(season, level, sport="women")
2370    
2371    # Get player stats for all teams
2372    logging.info("Loading player stats for all teams...")
2373    player_stats_list = []
2374    for _, team_row in tqdm(teams_df.iterrows(), total=len(teams_df), desc="Loading player stats"):
2375        try:
2376            # Pass team info to avoid lookup
2377            team_info = {
2378                "season": team_row["season"],
2379                "ncaa_division": team_row["ncaa_division"],
2380                "ncaa_division_formatted": team_row["ncaa_division_formatted"],
2381                "team_conference_name": team_row["team_conference_name"],
2382                "school_name": team_row["school_name"],
2383                "school_id": team_row["school_id"],
2384                "sport_id": "WVB"
2385            }
2386            stats = get_volleyball_player_season_stats(team_row['team_id'], team_info)
2387            player_stats_list.append(stats)
2388        except Exception as e:
2389            logging.warning(f"Failed to get stats for team {team_row['team_id']}: {e}")
2390    
2391    player_stats_df = pd.concat(player_stats_list, ignore_index=True) if player_stats_list else pd.DataFrame()
2392    
2393    return {
2394        'teams': teams_df,
2395        'schedule': schedule_df, 
2396        'player_stats': player_stats_df
2397    }
